_nefe_ I'm still downloading but I'm going to say that that is a false positive. Cracks and keygens are usually falsely tagged as viruses because they share a lot of similar coding.
Looking at your scan result kinda confirms this:
HEUR: (Heuristic) It isn't a recognized virus, but your scanner thinks it looks close enough to one to be dangerous.
Generic: It's not recognized as a speific trojan (because it could very well not be one) so it can't give it a name.

I'll scan it and post my results.
Scanned with Kapersky 2011 several times over, no viruses anywhere.

@Cleric21
Right click on the game and try "Run as administrator". Should probably save gameplay.
